intro: Vincetoxicum luridum, commonly known as the yellow woodbine, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, which includes many toxic plants. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive spurred structure. Vincetoxicum luridum is often found in moist woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in partial shade.
